details.purpose: Detailed clinical information about a menstrual cycle.
details.use: For inclusion within Menstrual cycle OBSERVATION.

items.items: Collection of normal statements about menstrual cycle.
Normal statement about the menstrual cycle.
Blood clots were present during cycle.
Description of the relative duration of menstrual cycle.
Menstrual cycle duration is longer than a 'usual' cycle.
Menstrual cycle duration is the same as a 'usual' cycle.
Menstrual cycle duration is the same as a 'usual' cycle.
Menstrual cycle duration is shorter than a 'usual' cycle.
Menstrual cycle duration is much shorter than a 'usual' cycle.
Menstrual cycle duration is much longer than a 'usual' cycle.
Description of the menstruation, or period of bleeding
Heavy menstrual flow that exceeds capacity sanitary napkins and other menstrual products to absorb the menstrual flow.
Relative description of menstrual blood flow.
Number of sanitary products used per day to absorb menstrual flow.
The amount of menstrual blood loss considered very heavy when compared to normal for the woman.
The amount of menstrual blood loss considered heavier than normal for the woman.
The amount of menstrual blood loss considered normal for the woman.
The amount of menstrual blood loss considered lighter than normal for the woman.
Small amounts of menstrual blood loss that may have no pattern.
Description of the characteristics of menstruation.
Details about use of Sanitary products during menstruation.
'Super' size/thickness of disposable pads worn in the underwear to absorb menstrual flow.
'Normal' size/thickness of disposable pads worn in the underwear to absorb menstrual flow.
'Light' size/thickness of disposable pads worn in the underwear to absorb menstrual flow.
'Super' size/thickness of disposable cylinders of absorbant material that are inserted into the vagina to absorb menstrual flow.
'Normal' size/thickness of disposable cylinders of absorbant material that are inserted into the vagina to absorb menstrual flow.
Natural sponges that are inserted into the vagina to absorb menstrual flow.
A firm, flexible bell-shaped device worn inside the vagina to catch menstrual flow. Reusable versions include rubber or silicone cups.
Re-usable fabric worn in the underwear to absorb menstrual flow.
Number of days since onset of last period.
Number of days since onset of last period.
